Thriller.title: The Silent Patient
Thriller.author: Alex Michaelides
Thriller.description: A therapist unravels the mystery behind a woman's selective mutism and the shocking crime she's accused of committing.

Thriller.title: The Woman in the Window
Thriller.author: A.J. Finn
Thriller.description: An agoraphobic woman witnesses a disturbing event in her neighbor's house, leading to a gripping psychological thriller.

Thriller.title: Gone Girl
Thriller.author: Gillian Flynn
Thriller.description: On their fifth wedding anniversary, Nick's wife Amy disappears, and all fingers point to him. But is everything as it seems?

Thriller.title: The Da Vinci Code
Thriller.author: Dan Brown
Thriller.description: Professor Robert Langdon is thrust into a whirlwind adventure as he unravels secrets hidden in the works of Leonardo da Vinci.

Thriller.title: The Girl on the Train
Thriller.author: Paula Hawkins
Thriller.description: Rachel, an alcoholic, becomes entangled in a missing person's investigation after witnessing something shocking from her train window.

Thriller.title: Before I Go to Sleep
Thriller.author: S.J. Watson
Thriller.description: Christine suffers from amnesia and wakes up every day with no memory of her life. As she tries to piece together her past, she discovers shocking truths.

Thriller.title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
Thriller.author: Stieg Larsson
Thriller.description: Lisbeth Salander is accused of triple murder, and journalist Mikael Blomkvist is determined to prove her innocence, uncovering a conspiracy along the way.

Thriller.title: Big Little Lies
Thriller.author: Liane Moriarty
Thriller.description: In a quiet seaside town, a school trivia night turns deadly, and the secrets of three women unravel amidst the investigation.

Thriller.title: The Wife Between Us
Thriller.author: Greer Hendricks, Sarah Pekkanen
Thriller.description: A psychological thriller about a tangled web of love, deceit, and betrayal between a woman, her ex-husband, and his new fiancée.

Thriller.title: The Reversal
Thriller.author: Michael Connelly
Thriller.description: Defense attorney Mickey Haller is recruited to prosecute a high-profile case, but the truth might be more complex than it seems.

Thriller.title: Before the Fall
Thriller.author: Noah Hawley
Thriller.description: After a private jet crashes, only two survivors remain, and the investigation into the crash reveals shocking secrets about the passengers.

Thriller.title: Behind Closed Doors
Thriller.author: B.A. Paris
Thriller.description: On the surface, Jack and Grace seem like the perfect couple, but behind closed doors, their marriage hides a dark secret.

Thriller.title: The Snowman
Thriller.author: Jo Nesbø
Thriller.description: Detective Harry Hole investigates a series of gruesome murders where the killer leaves a snowman as his calling card.

Romance.title: Pride and Prejudice
Romance.author: Jane Austen
Romance.description: The story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy's tumultuous relationship in early 19th-century England.

Romance.title: The Notebook
Romance.author: Nicholas Sparks
Romance.description: A sweeping love story that spans decades, about a young couple's journey through love, loss, and rediscovery.

Romance.title: Outlander
Romance.author: Diana Gabaldon
Romance.description: Claire Randall, a WWII nurse, is mysteriously transported to 18th-century Scotland, where she falls in love with a dashing Highlander.

Romance.title: Me Before You
Romance.author: Jojo Moyes
Romance.description: A heartwarming tale of an unlikely romance between a young woman and a paralyzed man, which challenges societal norms and perceptions.

Romance.title: The Fault in Our Stars
Romance.author: John Green
Romance.description: Hazel Grace Lancaster, a 16-year-old cancer patient, falls in love with Augustus Waters, another cancer survivor, and together they embark on a journey of love and loss.

Romance.title: One Day
Romance.author: David Nicholls
Romance.description: The story follows Emma and Dexter on the same day, July 15th, over 20 years, capturing the ups and downs of their complicated relationship.

Romance.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
Romance.author: Audrey Niffenegger
Romance.description: Henry DeTamble involuntarily travels through time, and his wife Clare, who lives a normal life, struggles to cope with his absence and sporadic appearances.

Romance.title: Anna and the French Kiss
Romance.author: Stephanie Perkins
Romance.description: A charming love story set in Paris, where Anna Oliphant navigates friendship, love, and self-discovery during her year abroad.

Romance.title: Attachments
Romance.author: Rainbow Rowell
Romance.description: Lincoln, a socially awkward IT guy, falls for Beth and Jennifer through their email conversations, but can he muster the courage to reveal himself?

Romance.title: Meant to Be
Romance.author: Lauren Morrill
Romance.description: Julia and Jason are polar opposites, but when they're stranded in London together, they discover that maybe they're meant to be after all.

Romance.title: The Hating Game
Romance.author: Sally Thorne
Romance.description: Lucy and Joshua, coworkers who can't stand each other, engage in a fierce rivalry, but their animosity masks a deeper attraction.

Romance.title: Eleanor & Park
Romance.author: Rainbow Rowell
Romance.description: Two misfits, Eleanor and Park, find solace in each other's company on the school bus, developing a deep and unexpected romance.

Romance.title: Attachments
Romance.author: Rainbow Rowell
Romance.description: Lincoln, a socially awkward IT guy, falls for Beth and Jennifer through their email conversations, but can he muster the courage to reveal himself?

Romance.title: Meant to Be
Romance.author: Lauren Morrill
Romance.description: Julia and Jason are polar opposites, but when they're stranded in London together, they discover that maybe they're meant to be after all.

Romance.title: The Hating Game
Romance.author: Sally Thorne
Romance.description: Lucy and Joshua, coworkers who can't stand each other, engage in a fierce rivalry, but their animosity masks a deeper attraction.

Science Fiction.title: Dune
Science Fiction.author: Frank Herbert
Science Fiction.description: Set in a distant future where noble families control planets, Dune follows the story of Paul Atreides as he navigates political intrigue and mystical prophecy on the desert planet of Arrakis.

Science Fiction.title: Neuromancer
Science Fiction.author: William Gibson
Science Fiction.description: Considered one of the defining works of the cyberpunk genre, Neuromancer follows the story of Case, a washed-up computer hacker, who is hired by a mysterious employer for one last job.

Science Fiction.title: Foundation
Science Fiction.author: Isaac Asimov
Science Fiction.description: Foundation is the first book in Asimov's iconic series, exploring the rise and fall of civilizations in a galaxy-spanning future, and the efforts of psychohistorian Hari Seldon to preserve knowledge and guide humanity.

Science Fiction.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Science Fiction.author: Douglas Adams
Science Fiction.description: A comedic science fiction series following the misadventures of Arthur Dent, an ordinary human who is rescued by Ford Prefect, an alien writer for the titular guide, just before Earth is destroyed to make way for an interstellar highway.

Science Fiction.title: Ender's Game
Science Fiction.author: Orson Scott Card
Science Fiction.description: Set in a future where Earth is at war with an alien species, Ender's Game follows the story of Ender Wiggin, a young boy recruited into a military training program to become humanity's greatest hope for survival.

Science Fiction.author: George Orwell
Science Fiction.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where the government, led by the oppressive figure Big Brother, monitors and controls every aspect of people's lives, with protagonist Winston Smith rebelling against the regime.

Science Fiction.title: The Martian
Science Fiction.author: Andy Weir
Science Fiction.description: When astronaut Mark Watney is stranded on Mars after a mission gone wrong, he must use his ingenuity and scientific knowledge to survive on the hostile planet until rescue becomes possible.

Science Fiction.title: Hyperion
Science Fiction.author: Dan Simmons
Science Fiction.description: The first book in the Hyperion Cantos series, Hyperion is a space opera that weaves together the stories of seven pilgrims journeying to the distant planet of Hyperion, each with their own motives and secrets.

Science Fiction.title: Brave New World
Science Fiction.author: Aldous Huxley
Science Fiction.description: A dystopian novel set in a future world where society is stratified into castes, and people are conditioned from birth to conform to their roles, with protagonist Bernard Marx challenging the status quo.

Science Fiction.title: Snow Crash
Science Fiction.author: Neal Stephenson
Science Fiction.description: A cyberpunk novel set in a future America where corporations wield immense power, and the protagonist, Hiro Protagonist, is a hacker and pizza delivery driver who becomes embroiled in a virtual reality conspiracy.

Science Fiction.title: The Left Hand of Darkness
Science Fiction.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
Science Fiction.description: Set on the planet Gethen, where its inhabitants can change gender at will, The Left Hand of Darkness follows the story of an envoy from the Ekumen as he navigates the complex politics and culture of the planet.

Science Fiction.title: Altered Carbon
Science Fiction.author: Richard K. Morgan
Science Fiction.description: In a future where consciousness can be transferred between bodies, Altered Carbon follows the story of Takeshi Kovacs, a former soldier turned private investigator, as he investigates a rich man's murder.

Science Fiction.title: Red Mars
Science Fiction.author: Kim Stanley Robinson
Science Fiction.description: The first book in the Mars Trilogy, Red Mars follows the story of the first settlers on Mars as they terraform the planet and grapple with political and environmental challenges.

Science Fiction.title: Jurassic Park
Science Fiction.author: Michael Crichton
Science Fiction.description: In a remote island off the coast of Costa Rica, scientists clone dinosaurs and create a theme park, but chaos ensues when the dinosaurs escape and wreak havoc on the island.

Science Fiction.title: The Expanse: Leviathan Wakes
Science Fiction.author: James S.A. Corey
Science Fiction.description: The first book in The Expanse series, Leviathan Wakes follows the crew of the Rocinante as they investigate a conspiracy that threatens to ignite interstellar war in the colonized solar system.

Education.title: Teach Like a Champion: 49 Techniques that Put Students on the Path to College
Education.author: Doug Lemov
Education.description: A practical guide for teachers to implement effective teaching techniques that promote student success and college readiness.

Education.title: How to Read a Book: The Classic Guide to Intelligent Reading
Education.author: Mortimer J. Adler, Charles Van Doren
Education.description: A comprehensive guide on the art of reading, covering various reading techniques and strategies to improve comprehension and critical thinking.

Education.title: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
Education.author: Carol S. Dweck
Education.description: Explores the concept of mindset and how having a growth mindset can lead to greater success and achievement in education and beyond.

Education.title: The First Days of School: How to Be an Effective Teacher
Education.author: Harry K. Wong, Rosemary T. Wong
Education.description: A comprehensive guide for new and experienced teachers on classroom management, lesson planning, and creating a positive learning environment.

Education.title: The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business
Education.author: Charles Duhigg
Education.description: Explores the science behind habit formation and how understanding habits can lead to personal and professional success.

Education.title: How Children Succeed: Grit, Curiosity, and the Hidden Power of Character
Education.author: Paul Tough
Education.description: Examines the role of non-cognitive skills such as grit, curiosity, and character in determining success and resilience in children.

Education.title: Make It Stick: The Science of Successful Learning
Education.author: Peter C. Brown, Henry L. Roediger III, Mark A. McDaniel
Education.description: Presents evidence-based strategies for effective learning and retention, challenging common misconceptions about studying and memory.

Education.title: The Smartest Kids in the World: And How They Got That Way
Education.author: Amanda Ripley
Education.description: Follows the experiences of American high school students studying abroad in countries with top-performing education systems, exploring what makes their education systems successful.

Education.title: The Art of Learning: An Inner Journey to Optimal Performance
Education.author: Josh Waitzkin
Education.description: Chronicles the author's journey from chess prodigy to martial arts champion, exploring principles of learning, mastery, and performance.

Education.title: Visible Learning: A Synthesis of Over 800 Meta-Analyses Relating to Achievement
Education.author: John Hattie
Education.description: Summarizes the findings of over 800 meta-analyses on educational research, identifying key factors that contribute to student achievement.

Education.title: Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us
Education.author: Daniel H. Pink
Education.description: Explores the science of motivation and the factors that drive human behavior, challenging traditional notions of rewards and incentives.

Education.title: The Teenage Brain: A Neuroscientist's Survival Guide to Raising Adolescents and Young Adults
Education.author: Frances E. Jensen, Amy Ellis Nutt
Education.description: Examines the unique characteristics of the teenage brain and provides insights and strategies for parents, educators, and policymakers.

Education.title: Weapons of Math Destruction: How Big Data Increases Inequality and Threatens Democracy
Education.author: Cathy O'Neil
Education.description: Explores the dark side of algorithms and big data, highlighting how they can perpetuate inequality and harm individuals and society.

Education.title: The End of Average: How We Succeed in a World That Values Sameness
Education.author: Todd Rose
Education.description: Argues against the notion of 'average' and advocates for personalized approaches to education and work that recognize individuality and diversity.

Education.title: Educated: A Memoir
Education.author: Tara Westover
Education.description: A memoir of the author's journey from a survivalist family in Idaho to earning a PhD from Cambridge University, exploring the power of education to transform lives.

Education.title: Python Crash Course
Education.author: Eric Matthes
Education.description: A hands-on, project-based introduction to Python programming, covering basic syntax, data structures, and key concepts for beginners.

Education.title: React: Up & Running
Education.author: Stoyan Stefanov
Education.description: A comprehensive guide to building user interfaces with React, covering core concepts, best practices, and real-world examples.

Education.title: Eloquent JavaScript: A Modern Introduction to Programming
Education.author: Marijn Haverbeke
Education.description: An in-depth introduction to JavaScript programming, covering language fundamentals, browser APIs, and advanced topics like functional programming.

Education.title: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites
Education.author: Jon Duckett
Education.description: A beginner-friendly guide to building websites with HTML and CSS, covering essential concepts, best practices, and design principles.

Education.title: The Rust Programming Language
Education.author: Steve Klabnik, Carol Nichols
Education.description: An authoritative guide to the Rust programming language, covering syntax, memory management, concurrency, and practical examples of Rust in action.

Biography.title: Steve Jobs
Biography.author: Walter Isaacson
Biography.description: A comprehensive biography of Steve Jobs, the co-founder of Apple Inc., exploring his visionary leadership, innovative products, and complex personality.

Biography.title: Becoming
Biography.author: Michelle Obama
Biography.description: Michelle Obama's memoir, recounting her journey from a childhood on the South Side of Chicago to becoming the First Lady of the United States.

Biography.title: Educated: A Memoir
Biography.author: Tara Westover
Biography.description: Tara Westover's memoir, depicting her upbringing in a survivalist family in Idaho and her quest for knowledge and education against all odds.

Biography.title: Leonardo da Vinci
Biography.author: Walter Isaacson
Biography.description: A biography of Leonardo da Vinci, the Renaissance polymath, examining his life, art, science, and enduring legacy.

Biography.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
Biography.author: Anne Frank
Biography.description: Anne Frank's diary, written during the Holocaust, offers a poignant and intimate account of her experiences in hiding during World War II.

Biography.title: Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future
Biography.author: Ashlee Vance
Biography.description: A biography of Elon Musk, the entrepreneur and CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, exploring his ambitious goals and innovative ventures.

Biography.title: Born a Crime: Stories from a South African Childhood
Biography.author: Trevor Noah
Biography.description: Trevor Noah's memoir, chronicling his upbringing in South Africa during apartheid and his journey to becoming a successful comedian and TV host.

Biography.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
Biography.author: Rebecca Skloot
Biography.description: A narrative nonfiction book that tells the story of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells were used without her consent to advance medical research, leading to groundbreaking discoveries.

Biography.title: Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption
Biography.author: Laura Hillenbrand
Biography.description: The biography of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic athlete and WWII bombardier who survived a plane crash, weeks adrift at sea, and brutal captivity in Japanese POW camps.

Biography.title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
Biography.author: Malcolm X, Alex Haley
Biography.description: Malcolm X's autobiography, co-written with Alex Haley, traces his transformation from a street hustler to a prominent civil rights leader and advocate for black empowerment.

Biography.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
Biography.author: Bryan Stevenson
Biography.description: Bryan Stevenson's memoir, recounting his experiences as a lawyer fighting for justice and equality, particularly for death row inmates and the wrongly convicted.

Biography.title: Hamilton: The Revolution
Biography.author: Lin-Manuel Miranda, Jeremy McCarter
Biography.description: A behind-the-scenes look at the creation of the Broadway musical 'Hamilton,' written by Lin-Manuel Miranda and inspired by the life of Alexander Hamilton.

Biography.title: Long Walk to Freedom
Biography.author: Nelson Mandela
Biography.description: Nelson Mandela's autobiography, detailing his lifelong struggle against apartheid in South Africa and his eventual presidency after years of imprisonment.

Biography.title: Lab Girl
Biography.author: Hope Jahren
Biography.description: Hope Jahren's memoir, interweaving her personal experiences as a female scientist with insights into the natural world and the challenges of scientific research.

Biography.title: The Wright Brothers
Biography.author: David McCullough
Biography.description: A biography of Orville and Wilbur Wright, the inventors of the first successful airplane, exploring their pioneering achievements and the obstacles they overcame.

Non-Fiction.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
Non-Fiction.author: Yuval Noah Harari
Non-Fiction.description: Explores the history of Homo sapiens from the emergence of modern humans in Africa to the present day, examining key milestones and developments in human civilization.

Non-Fiction.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck: A Counterintuitive Approach to Living a Good Life
Non-Fiction.author: Mark Manson
Non-Fiction.description: Presents a refreshing approach to self-help, advocating for embracing life's uncertainties and focusing on what truly matters, rather than pursuing constant positivity.

Non-Fiction.title: Educated: A Memoir
Non-Fiction.author: Tara Westover
Non-Fiction.description: Tara Westover's memoir, depicting her upbringing in a survivalist family in Idaho and her quest for knowledge and education against all odds.

Non-Fiction.title: Becoming
Non-Fiction.author: Michelle Obama
Non-Fiction.description: Michelle Obama's memoir, recounting her journey from a childhood on the South Side of Chicago to becoming the First Lady of the United States.

Non-Fiction.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
Non-Fiction.author: Dale Carnegie
Non-Fiction.description: A timeless classic on interpersonal relationships and communication skills, offering practical advice on building rapport, influencing others, and achieving success.

Non-Fiction.title: Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
Non-Fiction.author: James Clear
Non-Fiction.description: Provides actionable strategies for creating and maintaining good habits, based on the principles of behavior change and habit formation.

Non-Fiction.title: The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business
Non-Fiction.author: Charles Duhigg
Non-Fiction.description: Explores the science behind habit formation and how understanding habits can lead to personal and professional success.

Non-Fiction.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
Non-Fiction.author: Daniel Kahneman
Non-Fiction.description: A groundbreaking exploration of human cognition, highlighting the two systems of thinking and their impact on decision-making, judgment, and behavior.

Non-Fiction.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
Non-Fiction.author: Rebecca Skloot
Non-Fiction.description: A narrative nonfiction book that tells the story of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells were used without her consent to advance medical research, leading to groundbreaking discoveries.

Non-Fiction.title: Outliers: The Story of Success
Non-Fiction.author: Malcolm Gladwell
Non-Fiction.description: Examines the factors that contribute to high levels of success, challenging the myth of individual merit and emphasizing the importance of environment and opportunity.

Non-Fiction.title: Born a Crime: Stories from a South African Childhood
Non-Fiction.author: Trevor Noah
Non-Fiction.description: Trevor Noah's memoir, chronicling his upbringing in South Africa during apartheid and his journey to becoming a successful comedian and TV host.

Non-Fiction.title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking
Non-Fiction.author: Susan Cain
Non-Fiction.description: Explores the strengths and talents of introverts in a society that often values extroversion, offering insights into how introverts can thrive in various environments.

Non-Fiction.title: The Body: A Guide for Occupants
Non-Fiction.author: Bill Bryson
Non-Fiction.description: A fascinating exploration of the human body, covering its structure, functions, and remarkable capabilities, presented in Bill Bryson's engaging and accessible style.

Non-Fiction.title: Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Human Societies
Non-Fiction.author: Jared Diamond
Non-Fiction.description: Examines the factors that shaped human history, including geography, agriculture, and technology, offering insights into the unequal distribution of power and resources.

Non-Fiction.title: Man's Search for Meaning
Non-Fiction.author: Viktor E. Frankl
Non-Fiction.description: Viktor Frankl's memoir, recounting his experiences as a Holocaust survivor and the development of logotherapy, a psychotherapeutic approach focused on finding meaning in life.

Philosophy & Life.title: Meditations
Philosophy & Life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Philosophy & Life.description: A series of personal writings by the Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, offering insights and reflections on Stoic philosophy and the challenges of life.

Philosophy & Life.title: Man's Search for Meaning
Philosophy & Life.author: Viktor E. Frankl
Philosophy & Life.description: Viktor Frankl's memoir, recounting his experiences as a Holocaust survivor and the development of logotherapy, a psychotherapeutic approach focused on finding meaning in life.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Alchemist
Philosophy & Life.author: Paulo Coelho
Philosophy & Life.description: A novel by Brazilian author Paulo Coelho, following the journey of a young shepherd named Santiago as he seeks his 'Personal Legend' and learns about life's lessons and the pursuit of dreams.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
Philosophy & Life.author: Eckhart Tolle
Philosophy & Life.description: Explores the concept of mindfulness and living in the present moment, offering practical advice for achieving spiritual enlightenment and inner peace.

Philosophy & Life.title: Siddhartha
Philosophy & Life.author: Hermann Hesse
Philosophy & Life.description: A novel by German author Hermann Hesse, following the spiritual journey of Siddhartha Gautama as he seeks enlightenment and self-discovery.

Philosophy & Life.title: Letters from a Stoic
Philosophy & Life.author: Seneca
Philosophy & Life.description: A collection of letters by the Roman philosopher Seneca, addressing various aspects of Stoic philosophy and offering timeless wisdom on living a virtuous life.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Art of Happiness
Philosophy & Life.author: Dalai Lama XIV, Howard C. Cutler
Philosophy & Life.description: A book that combines the insights of the Dalai Lama with the perspectives of Western psychiatrist Howard Cutler, exploring the keys to true happiness and inner peace.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Road Less Traveled: A New Psychology of Love, Traditional Values and Spiritual Growth
Philosophy & Life.author: M. Scott Peck
Philosophy & Life.description: Blending psychology and spirituality, this book explores the importance of discipline, love, and spiritual growth in achieving fulfillment and personal transformation.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Prophet
Philosophy & Life.author: Kahlil Gibran
Philosophy & Life.description: A poetic collection of philosophical essays, offering insights into various aspects of life, including love, marriage, work, and spirituality.

Philosophy & Life.title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values
Philosophy & Life.author: Robert M. Pirsig
Philosophy & Life.description: Blending philosophy, travelogue, and autobiography, this book explores the author's journey of self-discovery and his philosophical reflections on quality and values.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Philosophy & Life.author: Don Miguel Ruiz
Philosophy & Life.description: Offers a code of conduct based on ancient Toltec wisdom, presenting four agreements to transform one's life and achieve personal freedom and happiness.

Philosophy & Life.title: Walden
Philosophy & Life.author: Henry David Thoreau
Philosophy & Life.description: A transcendentalist work by Henry David Thoreau, reflecting on nature, solitude, and self-reliance during his two-year experiment of living in a cabin near Walden Pond.

Philosophy & Life.title: Tao Te Ching
Philosophy & Life.author: Laozi
Philosophy & Life.description: An ancient Chinese philosophical text attributed to Laozi, offering insights into Taoism and the principles of harmony, simplicity, and the way of nature.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Untethered Soul: The Journey Beyond Yourself
Philosophy & Life.author: Michael A. Singer
Philosophy & Life.description: Explores the nature of consciousness and the path to spiritual growth and inner freedom, offering insights and practices for releasing limiting beliefs and emotions.

Philosophy & Life.title: The Bhagavad Gita
Philosophy & Life.author: Vyasa
Philosophy & Life.description: An ancient Indian scripture that presents a dialogue between Prince Arjuna and the god Krishna, offering insights into duty, righteousness, and the path to spiritual realization.

Crime Novels.title: The Girl on the Train
Crime Novels.author: Paula Hawkins
Crime Novels.description: A psychological thriller about a woman named Rachel who becomes embroiled in a missing persons investigation after witnessing something suspicious from the train.

Crime Novels.title: The Silence of the Lambs
Crime Novels.author: Thomas Harris
Crime Novels.description: An intense psychological thriller featuring FBI trainee Clarice Starling and incarcerated cannibalistic serial killer Dr. Hannibal Lecter, as they work together to catch another serial killer known as Buffalo Bill.

Crime Novels.title: Sharp Objects
Crime Novels.author: Gillian Flynn
Crime Novels.description: A psychological thriller about a journalist returning to her hometown to cover the murder of two young girls, while confronting her own troubled past and dysfunctional family.

Crime Novels.title: The Snowman
Crime Novels.author: Jo Nesbø
Crime Novels.description: A chilling Scandinavian crime novel featuring detective Harry Hole as he investigates the disappearance of a woman whose scarf is found wrapped around a snowman.

Crime Novels.title: Dark Places
Crime Novels.author: Gillian Flynn
Crime Novels.description: A gripping mystery novel about a woman named Libby Day who revisits the events of her family's murder twenty-five years ago, leading to shocking revelations about the truth.

Crime Novels.title: The Poet
Crime Novels.author: Michael Connelly
Crime Novels.description: A suspenseful crime novel featuring journalist Jack McEvoy and FBI agent Rachel Walling as they investigate a series of murders linked to a poet who uses Edgar Allan Poe's work as inspiration.

Crime Novels.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
Crime Novels.author: Alexander McCall Smith
Crime Novels.description: The first book in a cozy mystery series set in Botswana, featuring Precious Ramotswe as she opens the first female-owned detective agency in the country and solves various cases.

Crime Novels.title: Before I Go to Sleep
Crime Novels.author: S.J. Watson
Crime Novels.description: A psychological thriller about a woman suffering from amnesia, who wakes up every day with no memory of her past, and gradually uncovers dark secrets about her own life.

Crime Novels.title: The Alienist
Crime Novels.author: Caleb Carr
Crime Novels.description: A historical crime novel set in New York City in the late 19th century, featuring Dr. Laszlo Kreizler and newspaper reporter John Schuyler Moore as they investigate a series of gruesome murders.

Crime Novels.title: The Lincoln Lawyer
Crime Novels.author: Michael Connelly
Crime Novels.description: The first book in the Lincoln Lawyer series, featuring defense attorney Mickey Haller as he defends a wealthy client accused of murder, only to uncover a larger conspiracy.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
Religion/Spirituality.author: Eckhart Tolle
Religion/Spirituality.description: Explores the concept of mindfulness and living in the present moment, offering practical advice for achieving spiritual enlightenment and inner peace.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Alchemist
Religion/Spirituality.author: Paulo Coelho
Religion/Spirituality.description: A novel by Brazilian author Paulo Coelho, following the journey of a young shepherd named Santiago as he seeks his 'Personal Legend' and learns about life's lessons and the pursuit of dreams.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Seven Spiritual Laws of Success: A Practical Guide to the Fulfillment of Your Dreams
Religion/Spirituality.author: Deepak Chopra
Religion/Spirituality.description: Presents seven spiritual principles for achieving success and fulfillment in life, based on ancient wisdom and modern science.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Celestine Prophecy
Religion/Spirituality.author: James Redfield
Religion/Spirituality.description: A novel that blends adventure and spiritual wisdom, following a man's journey to Peru to uncover nine insights about life, consciousness, and human evolution.

Religion/Spirituality.title: A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life's Purpose
Religion/Spirituality.author: Eckhart Tolle
Religion/Spirituality.description: Explores the nature of ego and the path to spiritual enlightenment, offering insights and practices for transcending suffering and awakening to one's true self.

Religion/Spirituality.title: Man's Search for Meaning
Religion/Spirituality.author: Viktor E. Frankl
Religion/Spirituality.description: Viktor Frankl's memoir, recounting his experiences as a Holocaust survivor and the development of logotherapy, a psychotherapeutic approach focused on finding meaning in life.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Religion/Spirituality.author: Don Miguel Ruiz
Religion/Spirituality.description: Offers a code of conduct based on ancient Toltec wisdom, presenting four agreements to transform one's life and achieve personal freedom and happiness.

Religion/Spirituality.title: Siddhartha
Religion/Spirituality.author: Hermann Hesse
Religion/Spirituality.description: A novel by German author Hermann Hesse, following the spiritual journey of Siddhartha Gautama as he seeks enlightenment and self-discovery.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Seat of the Soul
Religion/Spirituality.author: Gary Zukav
Religion/Spirituality.description: Explores the concept of the soul and its evolution, presenting insights into spiritual growth, consciousness, and the alignment of one's personality with the soul's purpose.

Religion/Spirituality.title: The Road Less Traveled: A New Psychology of Love, Traditional Values and Spiritual Growth
Religion/Spirituality.author: M. Scott Peck
Religion/Spirituality.description: Blending psychology and spirituality, this book explores the importance of discipline, love, and spiritual growth in achieving fulfillment and personal transformation.

Young Adult.title: The Hunger Games
Young Adult.author: Suzanne Collins
Young Adult.description: Set in a dystopian future, this novel follows Katniss Everdeen as she volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death known as the Hunger Games.

Young Adult.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Young Adult.author: J.K. Rowling
Young Adult.description: The first book in the iconic Harry Potter series, following the young wizard Harry Potter as he discovers his magical heritage and begins his journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Young Adult.title: The Fault in Our Stars
Young Adult.author: John Green
Young Adult.description: A heart-wrenching novel about two teenagers, Hazel and Augustus, who meet in a cancer support group and embark on a journey of love, friendship, and self-discovery.

Young Adult.title: Twilight
Young Adult.author: Stephenie Meyer
Young Adult.description: The first book in the Twilight saga, featuring Bella Swan, a teenage girl who falls in love with Edward Cullen, a vampire, and becomes entangled in the supernatural world of vampires and werewolves.

Young Adult.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Young Adult.author: Stephen Chbosky
Young Adult.description: A coming-of-age novel told through letters, following Charlie as he navigates high school, friendship, love, and mental health issues.

Young Adult.title: Divergent
Young Adult.author: Veronica Roth
Young Adult.description: Set in a dystopian society divided into factions based on personality traits, this novel follows Tris Prior as she discovers her own identity and challenges the rigid social order.

Young Adult.title: To All the Boys I've Loved Before
Young Adult.author: Jenny Han
Young Adult.description: A charming romantic comedy about Lara Jean Song Covey, whose secret love letters are accidentally sent to her crushes, leading to unexpected relationships and self-discovery.

Young Adult.title: The Maze Runner
Young Adult.author: James Dashner
Young Adult.description: The first book in the Maze Runner series, following a group of teenagers trapped in a mysterious maze with no memory of their past, as they struggle to survive and unravel the secrets of their confinement.

Young Adult.title: The Book Thief
Young Adult.author: Markus Zusak
Young Adult.description: Narrated by Death, this novel tells the story of Liesel Meminger, a young girl living in Nazi Germany, who steals books and shares them with her neighbors, while grappling with the horrors of war and the power of words.

Young Adult.title: Eleanor & Park
Young Adult.author: Rainbow Rowell
Young Adult.description: A tender love story about two misfit teenagers, Eleanor and Park, who bond over music and comics, while navigating the challenges of family, identity, and first love.

Young Adult.title: The Selection
Young Adult.author: Kiera Cass
Young Adult.description: The first book in a dystopian romance series, following America Singer as she competes for the heart of Prince Maxon in a televised competition known as the Selection.

Young Adult.title: The Maze Runner
Young Adult.author: James Dashner
Young Adult.description: The first book in the Maze Runner series, following a group of teenagers trapped in a mysterious maze with no memory of their past, as they struggle to survive and unravel the secrets of their confinement.

Young Adult.title: City of Bones
Young Adult.author: Cassandra Clare
Young Adult.description: The first book in The Mortal Instruments series, following Clary Fray as she discovers she is a Shadowhunter and becomes embroiled in a world of demons, vampires, and werewolves.

Young Adult.title: Fangirl
Young Adult.author: Rainbow Rowell
Young Adult.description: A heartfelt novel about fanfiction, family, and first love, following introverted college freshman Cath as she navigates the challenges of independence and relationships.

Young Adult.title: Cinder
Young Adult.author: Marissa Meyer
Young Adult.description: The first book in The Lunar Chronicles series, a futuristic retelling of Cinderella, featuring a cyborg mechanic named Cinder who becomes involved in a rebellion against a tyrannical queen.

Young Adult.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Young Adult.author: Stephen Chbosky
Young Adult.description: A coming-of-age novel told through letters, following Charlie as he navigates high school, friendship, love, and mental health issues.

Young Adult.title: Six of Crows
Young Adult.author: Leigh Bardugo
Young Adult.description: The first book in the Six of Crows duology, following a band of six outcasts as they attempt a daring heist in the bustling city of Ketterdam, amidst political intrigue and magical forces.

Young Adult.title: The Hate U Give
Young Adult.author: Angie Thomas
Young Adult.description: A powerful novel about racism, police brutality, and activism, following sixteen-year-old Starr Carter as she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a police officer.

Young Adult.title: The Raven Boys
Young Adult.author: Maggie Stiefvater
Young Adult.description: The first book in The Raven Cycle series, following Blue Sargent as she becomes involved with a group of private school boys searching for the tomb of a Welsh king, and the magical secrets hidden in their small town.

Young Adult.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
Young Adult.author: Ransom Riggs
Young Adult.description: The first book in the Miss Peregrine's Peculiar Children series, featuring Jacob Portman as he discovers a hidden home for children with supernatural abilities and unravels the mysteries of his own family.
